page.title: 08Architecture in Debenham.
page.content: There is an unusually varied range of building styles in the village,dating from around 1400.The oldest is the fortress-style tower of St.Mary's Church,built in the tenth century.On Cross Green is a jettied,timber-framed building with an aisled frame.A mile south-east of the village is Crow's Hall,a seventeenth century brick-built moated mansion. Most of the older buildings are in the village centre where there has been much alteration,extension and infill, influenced by Georgian,Victorian and Modern styles.Some of the buildings are considerably different behind their facades.Many have had brick or rendered fronts or shop fronts added. There is growing interest in the con- servation and restoration of Debenham's architectural heritage.Illustrated lectures are given on this subject.
